A sanctuary for the non religious to openly share there feelings.

post_info.post_title: A sanctuary for the non religious to openly share there feelings.

I will get things started.
 
 I live in a very religious place.
 
 I don't like feeling of being a minority.
 
 There is also this funny sort of air of oppression here.
 
 A friend and his mother stayed with me for a week when I was young.
 
 I over herd his mother and mine talking and she said:
 
 "I have been to Russia, Czechoslovakia many communist countries and I have never felt more oppressed then I have here."

Well, what does it mean to be religious?
 
 Maybe people really are not religious. They're just pretending to be religious because they don't know what being religious is. Maybe being religious is an empty sort of thing to be.
Yes but, tell us about your feelings.

I think of myself as spiritual. I did not feel very spiritual when I sat for hours on the hard pew of a Christian church listening to listless hymns and hearing endlessly about hell and eternal life. I didn't question it. I was merely bored.
 
 In adulthood I can see how empty that existence and experience was and I can ask the adult questions:
 
 Why didn't the man in the pulpit discuss racism?
 
 Why didn't he discuss the injustice in America?
 
 Why did he keep harping on and on about eternal life when there was so much evil in the present life?
 
 Why wasn't I confronted with real things in my childhood instead of being spoonfed boring, tired old dogma?
What do you find comfort in in place of religion, if any thing?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  A sanctuary for the non religious to openly share there feelings.
